reviews.sentence: Great place to stay. This is a very good location for visiting Tucson. Facilities are first rate and service is top notch. We selected this hotel as the place to celebrate our wedding anniversary because of its location and the recommendation of our friends. Enjoyed our stay very much and we plan to go back.

Exceptional comfort and service. My wife and I enjoyed a three night stay at the Hilton East in Tucson recently and we could not be more pleased. We treated with kindness and everyone on the staff seemed to go out of their way to make our stay most enjoyable. The beds was exceptionally comfortable and the morning breakfasts were superb. We will be back for sure.

comfortable pretty hotel great staff. Very comfortable beautiful hotel. Comfortable extremely friendly helpful staff especially Philip who even took the trouble to put us on the road to the Cactus National Forest with the hotel van.

Quite Enjoyable. I stayed at the hotel for 4 days and had a lovely time. Breakfasts on the executive level were quite sufficient for a good start for the day. All of the staff that I encountered were helpful and polite. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

A good stay with friendly helpful staff. However the hotel needs improvements. The room was nice and the staff were helpful and friendly. And the hotel was accessible in Tucson to visit family. There was not a refridgator offered in the room and compared to the other hotels I stayed during my vacation the hotel was not as nice. The hotel and rooms were aged need re modeling.
My wife and I had a great experience at your hotel. Staff was so polite and charming all the way down to the house staff. Thanks for having great Customer Service we appreciate it The Phoenix Moores.

Excellent service and value. pleasantly surprised. We were so happy with the facilities and service we received at this hotel. I was a little nervous about what the property might be like because the price was so reasonable. Hotel is very nice. staff was so friendly and accommodating. Would definitely stay here again if we are in the area.

Great location. Very happy with our stay while visiting tucson. The staff was very friendly and helpful with tips about the tucson area. Location was very convenient as you are close to downtown. Pool is decent. Definitely not a resort hotel but perfect for those looking for a comfortable stay in a location with easy access to all Tucson has to offer.

Great hotel. Staff go out of their way to make every guest feel welcomed. Linda at the front desk is incredible. can not say enough great things about the staff. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Breakfast was wonderful. Absolutely love this hotel.
Restaurant personnel are very kind and helpful.

Bring ear protection. This hotel needs to get new air conditioning units. When they come on in the middle of the night they ’re so loud I literally jumped up several times. Not a good night ’s rest. Decent restaurant although the service could be better.

232 rooms. ONE working elevator. This is an attractive hotel with newly updated rooms and public spaces. But it has an Achilles heel only 2 elevators. There truly should be 4 at a hotel this size. This lack of foresight became painfully obvious during my recent 4 night stay when one of the elevators was down for maintenance and I never saw it being worked on. To make matters worse the residential floors are inaccessible from the stairways for security reasons otherwise I would have been happy to take the stairs to my 6th floor room. So what happened is that there was the ludicrous situation of people boarding the UP elevator in order to go DOWN knowing that there would be no room for them if they waited on the down elevator. I suggested that management open up the service elevator for guest use but that idea was rejected. I also had problems with housekeeping not wanting to do their work perhaps because of understafing I am not sure. But that issue was resolved by the friendly front desk staff. So assuming that the elevator will be fixed and no one on the staff seemed to know when that would occur I suppose it is an ok place to stay but my particular visit was quite unpleasant for the reasons mentioned.

Okay Stay. Your expectations when staying at a Hilton are much higher. This did not meet those standards. The internet was absolutely abysmal even the paid internet was awful. The concierge when on duty never lifted his head from his phone nor greeted anyone. The front desk staff as well kept their heads down and did not greet when people entered the lobby. The pool was still ice cold the on site restaurant was overpriced. The 2 exceptions Shy at the front desk and Chris in the shop were very personable friendly as well as going over and above for their guests. What a good example for the rest of the staff.

Great hotel great views. Had a late check in but it was easy breezy getting my room. Woke up to a beautiful view with distant mountains. Room was clean and comfortable. I ordered room service due to it being a work trip and not having a vehicle of my own. Room service was prompt and tasty. Great stay. And for a Hilton it was cheaper than others I ’ve stayed at which was helpful to my travel budget.

Do not stay if you value your possessions. I do not wish to add to the cacophony of negative reviews that is the Internet but I feel compelled to do this as a public service. If you find yourself in Tucson please do not STAY at the Hilton Tucson East. At least I f you value your possessions. I was staying with my friends this past weekend for Camp Fangamer expo and we checked our bags at the front desk at noon on the last day of the convention. I had to leave early so I picked up my bag from the front desk. We were told there was an issue with accessing the safe and we would have to wait. But other than being slightly inconvenienced we gave it little thought. When I got home later that day at around 630 PM I discovered that my Nintendo Switch along with five games and the carrying case they were all in had been stolen. Additionally so had my bottle of cologne. While it can be argued I should have packed the items more securely how can I do be blamed for leaving my items with the hotel and having them disapearthat is nothing to say of the fact that the lock for the pool area was unlocked or the slow restaurant service or the fact the stairs are unkempt and located far in the back with only access to the parking lot and nothing else. These were issues I could otherwise overlook if I felt like my items were safer in the hotel than the trunk of my car. I beg you for your own security consider going somewhere else if you need a hotel in Tucson.

We had a fridge that would not get cold. Asked for a fix twice nothing happened. Found dirty towels on the bath room floor after the room was supposedly cleaned. Front desk uncaring. Lots of little things for example ice bucket bag too small only 2 small marshmallow pillows furniture not comfortable noisy and not what we expected from a Hilton or from the price.

Not a bad place very nice. Only four stars because the cleaning staff did not empty the trash nor replenish the coffee. I am sure they would have fixed it right away had I called the front desk but I should not have to do that.

The room was not comfortable for two people to share. Only one seating to watch tv or eat. Linens were old worn grey. No maid service by 4 pm. No info about hotel or services in room. Not what i expected from Hilton.
Tucson. Great hotel. Love the room and amenities. The only real problem is the hotel elevator was out of service.

Sewer smell. Walked into our room and was smacked in the face with a sewer smell that would make your eyes water. I booked an executive suite and my wife was less than impressed. Staff jumped on it fairly quickly unplugging the sink and masking the smell which slowly began to fade. Then the TV would not work. Staff jump again and fixed it other than that. well you get the picture.
Great Mountain View ’s. One elevator was out so at times was inconvenient but the staff was very nice and helpful.
